Key Match Events: Tyler Herro scored 32 points to lead the Heat to a 119-108 win over the Pelicans
The Heat scored the first five points of the second half to take a 61-51 lead
Robinson answered with seven consecutive Heat points to give them an 80-70 lead
Miami finished with a 10-2 run that gave it a 90-76 lead at the end of the third quarter
The Pelicans crept within 111-104 within on a 3-pointer by McCollum with 2:47 left
Pre-Game Insights: Jimmy Butler returned from a five-game absence caused by a flu-like illness and finished with nine points in 25 minutes
Guard Terry Rozier served a one-game suspension that he received for his role in a skirmish in the final minute of a 104-100 victory at Houston on Sunday
Post-Match Reflections: The Heat defeated the New Orleans Pelicans 119-108, their 11th straight defeat
Bam Adebayo added 23 points, 10 assists and nine rebounds, Duncan Robinson scored 17 points, Jaime Jaquez Jr. put up 12 and Kelâ€™el Ware added 10 for the Heat
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nikola Jovic beat the buzzer with a 3-pointer that gave the Heat a 36-24 lead at the end of the first quarter
The Heat scored the first seven points of the game and raced to a 20-5 lead as Adebayo scored five points and Herro added four
Others: The Pelicans lost their 11th consecutive game and fell for the 20th time in 21 games
